page.title: 08Kingsgate and Bates Farms
page.content: At{Kingsgate Farm}Mr. Luethi has 2 tractors, 1 old and 1 new. He has 13 acres of pasture for sheep and cattle which also eat hay and nuts. There 22 acres of woodland as well as 2 acres of farm buildings. Mr. Luethi grows maize; he has a special combine to harvest it which is the only one in the country. Instead of oil seed rape, Mr. Luethi is growing sunflowers for oil this year for the first time. At{Bates Farm}most of the buildings are old with the addition of 2 purpose built grain stores; there is an old bull pen which is now a stable. There are 7 tractors and 1 combine, 5 of them are up to date, 2 are not. The farm is 600 acres in all, but only 200 acres are in Wittersham, the rest in New Romney. We saw 3 calves which were bought in Ashford Market on 13th May 1985.
